Vehicle.Name: Z-95-AF4-H "Heavy-95" Multi-Role Starfighter
Vehicle.Description:
[H3]Z-95-AF4-H "Heavy-95" Multi-Role Starfighter[h3]
A variant of the old, reliable Z-95 Headhunter, the Heavy-95 is the result of a recent service life extension program for Headhunters serving in the Rebel Alliance. The Heavy-95 project sought to extend the service life of existing Z-95s by performing numerous upgrades and overhauls to bring the elderly fighters up to the standard of modern lightweight starfighters. Each Heavy-95 was stripped of all its systems and rebuilt from the ground up using upgraded systems where they were needed and new original production parts where available. The four low-output Incom 2a ion fission engines were replaced with a pair of 4L4 fusial thrust engines typically found on the T-65 X-wing, an astromech socket and hyperdrive were fitted, and the wingtip-mounted light laser cannons were replaced with T&B Kx5 medium laser cannons. The fighter also houses an alternating-fire concussion missile launcher system that allows the pilot to fire off a steady stream of concussion missiles. The resulting fighter is a capable, easy-to-fly, lightweight multi-role fighter that features a good mix of speed, protection, and firepower.
